TextAsset.value: Mr. Driller!
Thank goodness I found you.
What are you doing?
Aren’t you afraid someone’s going to see you?
I’ll be done really quick!
All the teachers are gone now, so I bet they won’t notice me.
You know, there’s such a thing as taking your passion too far…
Nonsense!
Oh haha, wow, you were right!
There’s TONS of great dirt out today.
How did you know?
You must be like, a secret digging sage or something.
Oh haha… Gosh.. Wow… I wouldn’t go that far....
(Wh- Seriously?! THAT’S making me blush?!)
You know… I bet if Dad could see me now…
He’d be proud of what a good job I’m doing, you know?
I mean… how can you not appreciate this?
The sun on your back… The drills happily buzzing away…
It’s like heaven!
Er, don’t look now, but I think your father…
CAN see you now…
WHAAAT?!
Right over there, see?
That’s Principal DigDug standing there, isn’t it?
If we hurry, we can get back to detention before he gets here!
Oh….
Phew!
${slot:playerName}, you’re silly.
That’s not my dad!
That’s the STATUE of my dad.
The one I, uh…
Kinda sorta defaced.
(Oh… Yeah.
Now that I’m looking a little more closely…
That’s definitely just a statue.
And he has a big fat mustache dug right into his face.
Looks pretty suave, actually.)
Although wouldn’t it be great if I could do that to my dad for real? Haha!
Mr. Driller! That’s taking it too far!
I… I only meant metaphorically!
What would that even be a metaphor for, anyway?!
I dunno, some kinda emotional trauma roughly equal to the one he’s inflicting on me?
You know… father-son stuff.
… Mr. Driller…
I know you don’t like to admit it, but…
You’ve got some really dark thoughts in that helmet of yours.
Can’t you admit that your relationship with your dad is…
Not exactly typical?
Yeah…
I know.
I’m not trying to be nosy, it’s just…
It’s not healthy to keep stuff bottled up like that.
...It’s not like I...actually HATE my dad or anything...
I just get so angry, you know?
He shouldn’t have just… given up.
Mr. Driller…
Why did your dad give up digging?
You said something about your mom…
Did she not like it, or something?
He said he got too…
“Obsessive”...
But I don’t know.
What’s wrong with putting what you love above everything else?
Isn’t that how you achieve greatness in life?
Hey, watch it!
You’re digging faster and faster…
Don’t you think that’s a little too much?
That’s what Dad said…
That he dug “too much”.
But he was also the one who told me…
That if you never stopped digging, you could get all the way to the other side of the world!
Mr. Driller!
You have to stop!
You’re digging way too far and way too fast!
Don’t tell me what to do, ${slot:playerName}!
I thought you understood how I feel about digging!
Of course I do! It’s kinda impossible to miss!
But...
This seems more like anger than passion…
And besides, if you’re not careful, you’re going to hit a-
...Pipe.
Uh oh.
(Suddenly, a huge geyser of water bursts from the pipe where it was pierced by the drill.
Mr. Driller and I are both getting flung high into the air!)
WAAAAUUUUGGGHHH!
AUUUUGGGGHHH!!!
I think we landed….
Yeah… it feels like we’re on…
A pile of rocks or something.
Oh no…
Oh no.
Oh no oh no oh no oh NO!
(I open my eyes, and all of a sudden…
I can see why Mr. Driller is so upset.
This pile of rocks…
Is the rubble of what used to be the statue of Principal DigDug.
The water gushed right down on top of it, and it was destroyed.
Mr. Driller looks like he’s about to cry…
Oh no, now some of the other students are gathering around!
...I might cry, too.)
WHOAH! Look what Little D did to the statue of Big D!
AWESOME!
Taira! What is WRONG with you?!
Yeah, you’re right…
It was TOTALLY awesome.
Destruction of school property is most certainly not awesome!
Where was the Hall Monitor during all of this?! Honestly…
H-hey! D-don’t look at me!
Guys… can you… give us some space, please?
Hey, groovy! Vandalism of beloved school property!
I really enjoy that sort of edgy illegal activity. Any of you want to have a conversation about that?
Are you all insane?!
I’m getting the principal.
Hey, wait-
Ugh! She’s gone already. How does that girl move so fast?
${slot:playerName}… My dad’s gotta know I didn’t mean to do that, right…?
I mean...
I never thought…
...I’m going to be in sooo much trouble.
Son, don’t worry, I’m not mad at you.
Y-you’re not? That’s a relief.
Well, no, not really.
I actually am extremely mad at you.
I guess what I meant to say is, I’m mad, but also happy.
Because what you’ve done today has finally shown you that I was right to tell you not to dig.
I just want what’s best for you, my son.
And what’s best is squashing the one thing that brings you true fulfillment in this miserable life!
You know, like I did.
Um…
What about me?
I was there too...
You, I’m just plain mad at.
Wait your turn, though.
${slot:playerName}… ${slot:playerName} didn’t do anything.
That’s exactly right, boy.
${slot:playerName} didn’t do anything.
${slot:playerName} just watched you drill your way to kingdom come.
(Man, this is kinda unfair.)
Son, I want you to know…
I’m not trying to make your life miserable.
I’m trying to make it better.
Your mother left because I couldn’t stop obsessing about digging.
But ever since I put away my drills and shovels for good…
My life has gotten so much better.
I just want the same for you.
(He lives alone…
He seems angry all the time…
And he seems to be putting a wedge between himself and his son…
Is his life really that much better?
Jeez. This is really depressing.)
Dad...
I just wanted to dig…
I know, son.
But the only good digging you can do now…
Is digging a hole to bury that part of yourself in.
I promise, son. You’ll feel so much better.
Are you sure that’s good advice to give your son?!
Mr. Driller doesn’t just like digging…
He LIVES it.
You’re asking him to bury his whole life!
Watch it, ${slot:playerName}.
You’re on thin ice already.
You’ve already been in trouble twice!
Three strikes, ${slot:playerName}, and you’re out.
(I guess he’s right…
I better keep my mouth shut.)
Dad…
I think you’re right.
I’ve got to get free of these stupid drills
Please… take them… and put them somewhere where they can’t do anything bad anymore.
Mr. Driller?! No!
(I can’t believe it…
I’m watching Mr. Driller turn in his drills with my own eyes.
...Is he gonna call himself something different now?
Mr. Nothing-er?)
I’m proud of you, son…
You’re doing the right thing.
You’re already avoiding all the mistakes I made.
Mr. Driller…
How could you do that?
How could you give up your passion like that?
Because of those drills, I got you in trouble.
You could be expelled…
Just because I couldn’t stop myself from digging.
You… just got a little excited, that’s all.
(Actually he did seem kinda obsessed…
But that isn’t what he needs to hear right now.)
I told you about how digging is about discovery.
Well, I never considered the fact that…
If you dig deep enough, you might find something you wish you hadn’t.
...Yeah…
I see what you’re saying…
And I’m not just talking about the pipe.
Yeah.
I’m talking about… something deeper.
Like, emotions-wise.
Uh huh. I got it.
I mean to say it’s a metaphor.
(I don’t know what metaphor means, but it sounds deep and meaningful…)
I get it already! A metaphor for what exactly?
…${slot:playerName}, when I saw that destroyed statue, I was horrified…
But also a part of me felt happy.
And that horrified me even more.
I think a part of me really wanted to destroy it…
There really is something destructive in me, and the drills let it out.
I did that on purpose, to my own father! …
Or at least, a statue of my own father…
I never realized how deep my anger went.
(Well, he’s late to the party on that particular discovery…
But still...
This is awful.
I’ve gotta say something to cheer him up.)
So, uh…
...Yeah?
Pretty good… dirt today, huh?
Just like I said.
${slot:playerName}… let me give you a hug…
(Whoah…)
I’m so sorry about what happened today!
I hope you can forgive me...
It… It’s okay…
(I hope he can’t tell that I’m blushing.)
